intro: Siphanthera microlicioides, commonly known as the small-leafed bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
